reasoning: The transcription provides a step-by-step guide on how to prepare and cook a grilled steak with zucchini as a garnish, seasoned with salt, pepper, and oil, and finished with anchovy butter. The steps include seasoning the steak and zucchini, grilling techniques, resting the meat, and serving with garnish and anchovy butter.
dish_description: The dish is a classic grilled steak, seasoned and marked on the grill, served with a garnish of zucchini and topped with anchovy butter. The steak is cooked to a rare doneness and allowed to rest to ensure even juiciness.

cooking_steps.description: Season the steak on both sides with salt and pepper.
Apply a dash of oil on both sides of the steak.
Cut the zucchini into four pieces and season with a little salt and a dash of oil.
Place the steak on the grill with the grill lines going diagonally and cook for about a minute.
Turn the steak 90 degrees on the same side to create grill marks and cook for another minute.
Flip the steak to the other side and repeat the grilling process to create grill marks, ensuring it's cooked evenly and marked beautifully on both sides.
Allow the steak to rest for 5-6 minutes on a rack or 10 minutes for larger cuts like a standing rib roast to let the juices redistribute.
Serve the steak with the zucchini garnish, using the accumulated juices and topping the steak with a tablespoon of anchovy butter.
